intro: Hieracium berdoense, commonly known as the Berdoens hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and produces yellow composite flowers that bloom in late summer. Native to southern Europe, it thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. The plant has a taproot system and is often found in disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for studying plant adaptation to arid environments.
